Class Database

java.lang.Object
dev.royalcore.api.data.Database
public class Database extends Object
Simple asynchronous SQLite database helper for RoyaleCore.

This class manages a single SQLite connection and provides table-scoped Database.DatabaseSession instances for async CRUD-style operations.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    Database.DatabaseSession
    Table/session abstraction; all methods are asynchronous and thread-safe.

  • Constructor Details

    • Database

      public Database(String dbPath, org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
      Creates a new database helper for the given path.
      Parameters:
      dbPath - path to database, e.g. "plugins/YourPlugin/database.db"
      plugin - main plugin instance for logging and lifecycle integration

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public void connect() throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException
      Opens a connection to the configured SQLite database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
      ClassNotFoundException - if the SQLite JDBC driver class cannot be found

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Waits for all async DB work to finish and closes the database connection.

      Should be called in your plugin's onDisable().

    • use

      public Database.DatabaseSession use(String tableName)
      Returns a session bound to the given logical table name.

      The physical table name is prefixed with data_ and validated to contain only alphanumeric characters and underscores.

      Parameters:
      tableName - the logical table name to operate on
      Returns:
      a Database.DatabaseSession for the given table
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the table name contains invalid characters

    • runAsync

      protected <T> CompletableFuture<T> runAsync(Callable<T> task, String context)
      Submits a database task to run asynchronously on the dedicated executor.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type of the callable
      Parameters:
      task - the callable to execute
      context - a short description used in error logging
      Returns:
      a CompletableFuture representing the task result
